Issues.Title: LinkLabel is not rendered correctly when it is enabled=false
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I don't know

### Issue description

LinkLabel is not rendered correctly when it is not enabled. There is no problem when it is enabled.
The latest character is not visible, or latest character's half is visible.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/106665359/38cd3390-05d3-4005-b68a-cad93ae6e406)


### Steps to reproduce

LinkLabel AutoSize=false
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "LinkLabel is not rendered correctly when it is enabled=false" (#9182)

Yes, it doesn't reproduced in .Net 7.0.

### Issue description

Exception pops up when executing ImageList.ImageCollection.SetKeyName(Int32 index, String name), it may be caused by PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9073

**Failed log:**

System.IndexOutOfRangeException
  HResult=0x80131508

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a .NET Core 8.0 application with ImageList Control
2. Open ImageList smart tag and click "Choose images"

Issues.Title: [release/8.0-preview5] Fixed PrintPreviewControl accessibility bounds calculation
Issues.Body:
Backport of #9187 to release/8.0-preview5
This fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9175 in Preview5, where it was introduced.
/cc @Tanya-Solyanik @v-elnovikova

## Customer Impact
We had regressed MSAA `Bounds` property in Preview 5 when fixing a UIA property `BoundingRectangle` and caused failure in the automation tests. The difference is inclusion of nonclient area(scroll bars) in the UIA property. This issue is a blocking one for Winforms CTI test team.

## Testing
manual, under MSAA and UIA

## Risk
Low - can affect only accessibility tools of automation tests

PR #9136 has changed calculation of `AccessibilityObject.Bounds` property of `PrintPreviewControl` to include non-client area of the control. That fixed bounds of UIA object but broke MSAA object.

This PR modifies calculations to make bounds correct in both MSAA and UIA modes.

## Proposed changes

- Override PrintPreviewControlAccessibleObject's `BoundingRectangle` instead of `Bounds`.
- Fix unit tests for `PrintPreviewControlAccessibleObject.Bounds` property.
- Add unit tests for `PrintPreviewControlAccessibleObject.BoundingRectangle` property.


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

Before PR #9136 MSAA client  and non-client bounds were correct, but UIA bounds were too small.

MSAA non-client bounds:
![before_9136_msaa_window](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/803603f7-3595-4ec7-aa86-4d11851999b1)

MSAA client bounds:
![before_9136_msaa_client](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/ce91fd8e-45c5-4242-9597-4f189bbfc768)

UIA bounds:
![before_9136_uia](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/dbc4d5b0-99e2-4bee-a5d9-389a12f077ed)

PR #9136 fixed UIA bounds, but broke MSAA client bounds, which now include non-client areas.

MSAA non-client bounds:
![after_9136_msaa_window](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/5eda7204-fcd7-4bd7-b213-7074edb28ea1)

MSAA client bounds:
![after_9136_msaa_client](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/359fad68-414f-4ab7-aff2-1605f0b4f6e3)

UIA bounds:
![after_9136_uia](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/b62eb617-00a5-4e53-b297-2c49693c76f6)

### After

All bounds are correct:

MSAA non-client bounds:
![fixed_msaa_window](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/26aa12ca-efa9-4bfc-a321-9eea1f3d0458)

MSAA client bounds:
![fixed_msaa_client](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/1e2300be-791c-4643-82dc-57f03721f61d)

UIA bounds:
![fixed_uia](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/134eb86f-489e-4b0a-a534-124951ededd8)



## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 8.0.0-preview.4.23259.5
-  Accessibility Insights 1.1.2213.1

<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: Bounds for PrintPreviewControl and its accessible object don't match
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.5.23274.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works in .NET 6.0/7.0. Regression form: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9136

### Issue description

Testapp: [testapp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11563155/testapp.zip)

.NET 8.0
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/f83342cb-8025-4354-9e3e-6c16ea8fd211)

.NET 7.0
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/b4e2145b-ff3f-49f0-884e-c324cfbe7ca5)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core project.
2. Add a button and printPreviewControl control to form designer.
3. Double click button1 and type below code in function button1_Click.
```
AccessibleObject accessibleObject = printPreviewControl1.AccessibilityObject;
Rectangle rectangle1 = accessibleObject.Bounds;
Rectangle rectangle2 = printPreviewControl1.RectangleToScreen(printPreviewControl1.ClientRectangle);
```
4. Add a breakpoint at the end of the event, build and run the application.
5. Compare the values of rectangle1 and rectangle2.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bounds for PrintPreviewControl and its accessible object don't match" (#9175)

Issues.Title: The next focus position is not correct when selecting on a ToolStripButton using mouse or typing "enter" keyboard and then typing "right or left" keyboard.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 8.0.100-preview.5.23274.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

For .NET core 3.1 and .NET 5.0, the behavior is same as .NET framework: 
When typing Right keyboard, the next focus position is first item on the left. 
When typing Left keyboard, the next focus position is first item on the Right. 

For .NET 6.0/7.0/8.0, the behavior is: the next focus position is first item on the left, regardless of whether the right or left key is typed. 


### Issue description

When selecting on a ToolStripButton using mouse or typing "enter" keyboard and then typing "right or left" keyboard, the next focus position is first item on the left, regardless of whether the right or left key is typed. 
![ReproSteps](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/62929087/41a14002-002c-4f1c-b19d-3d7366eb3fa4)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Extract and open the test app. 
[TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11572425/TestApp.zip)
2. Build and run this project.
3. Select on a ToolStripButton using mouse or typing "enter" keyboard.
4. Type "right or left" keyboard.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The next focus position is not correct when selecting on a ToolStripButton using mouse or typing "enter" keyboard and then typing "right or left" keyboard. " (#9181)

Issues.Title: Failed to Clipboard.GetData() as the specified format
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.5.23274.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works in .NET 6.0/7.0/8.0.100-preview5.23253.20. Maybe caused by: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9088

### Issue description

Testapp: [Testapp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11572062/Testapp.zip)

.NET 8.0
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/281bcb3c-3ec9-4f26-8b21-8f113dc4eae4)

.NET 7.0
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/eb312cea-aab2-4f02-b255-5f60521144b2)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms .NET Core project.
2. Add a button control to form designer, double click button1 and type below code in function button1_Click.
```
Color c = System.Drawing.Color.Black;
string format = "testabc";
Clipboard.Clear();
Clipboard.SetData(format, c);
Clipboard.ContainsData(format);
object ob = null;
ob = Clipboard.GetData(format);
```
3. Add a breakpoint at the end of the event, build and run the application, click button1.
4. Observe the value of ob.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Failed to Clipboard.GetData() as the specified format" (#9180)

Issues.Title: Toolstripmenuitem under menubar cannot clearly distinguish checkstate is checked or unchecked
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.5.23274.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this issue also repro in .NET7.0 & .NET 6.0 & .NET 5.0 & .NET 3.1.

### Issue description

Toolstripmenuitem under menubar cannot clearly distinguish checkstate is checked or unchecked

Toolstripbutton under menubar can learly distinguish checkstate is checked or unchecked, checked state has rectangle box.
![toolstripmenuitem](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/4d59b139-7c7d-406f-9356-3e350167ebc5)

Toolstripmenuitem under menu can clearly distinguish checkstate is checked or unchecked, checked state has check symbol.
![Screenshot 2023-05-25 081546](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/ed0dc811-4660-4297-9a33-4ba381df9cb4)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .net core application with MenuStrip control
2. Add 2 menuitem under menubar
3. Change toolstripmenuitem2 checkstate property is checked
4. Build and run application
5. Observe toolstripmenuitem2

or use this sample application:
[test.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11562500/test.zip)

Issues.Title: DataGridViewDesigner is missing in System.Windows.Forms.Design namespace (.NET 6/7)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7 windows
.NET 6 windows

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

it does not look it was ever ported to .NET Core

### Issue description

We use .NET System.Windows.Forms.Design services for the run-time implementation of the Form designer functionality.
Under .NET Framework 4.6+ we could invoke DataGridView designer by clicking on the action item to add columns, etc.
It seems that this class completely missing in .NET 6/7

### Steps to reproduce

We have our demo projects here:
https://github.com/alternetsoft/alternet-studio-examples
The issue can be reproduced with FormDesigner demo, it can not load designer at all and displays DataGridView as a component.
If we use ControlDesigner instead of DataGridViewDesigner, it works fine, but does not display additional action items.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridViewDesigner is missing in System.Windows.Forms.Design namespace (.NET 6/7)" (#9165)

Issues.Title: Make AccessibleObject owner references weak references
Issues.Body:
This is to help ensure that the owner references can be be collected if the AccessibleObject CCW is the only thing still alive. We fall back onto "default" behavior if the related component is gone.

Added an internal IAccessibleOwner interface to allow attaching behavior to different AccessibleObject hierarchies. Changed most usages to TryGetOwnerAs to make it easier to audit Owner access.
